definition: stepping-stone to greater power or higher rank
to go forward/to advance/to go in/to enter/to put in/to submit/to take in/to admit/(math.) base of a number system/classifier for sections in a building or residential compound
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158

sentences.english: Failure is a stepping stone to success.
sentences.chinese: 失敗是成功的進身之階。

sentences.english: People tend to read as to obtain title-stepping stone, knocked at the door of the brick.
sentences.chinese: 世人往往將讀書當成求取功名的進身之階，敲門之磚。
